channel.title: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally
channel.description: I mean Aryan has been dead for a while now, can we finally remove the section. There is no need for it and all it does is create a place for noobs to spam about "OMG leik wat r ayran?!!?"

item.title: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

No need for this topic anymore.

Request done, now the topic has turned to spam.

Locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Nah I meant that a simple(not to simple!) puzzle would be nice to weed out some idiots(like the ones that can’t spell) IMO. Or maybe some kind of spelling test(ROFL).

Read full topic
item.source: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally

item.title: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:27, topic:52916”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=74526.msg852502#msg852502 date=1170389072]

Locked registration would be wondrous.

Maybe its been mentioned already in this thread I don’t know, but there will be quiz system that is basically easy, and the questions are made so that the answers could easily be found on google. This will make sure that people are willing to help themselves before joining, and that wipes out a very large portion of the problems.

Thank god, maybe even a little puzzle would be nice to test their intelligence, not like a hard one or anything…

How about a sliding puzzle in an applet that isn’t solvable until you decompile it/figure out the html/some other thing requiring general knowlege.
[/quote]
The point of this is not to make sure that only java coders join, it’s to filter out the complete idiots refusing to learn anything.[/quote]

I don’t mean exclusively Java coders, I mean anyone who has the capacity to figure out a challenge. But that challenge has to be presentable within a web page.

Read full topic

Maybe its been mentioned already in this thread I don’t know, but there will be quiz system that is basically easy, and the questions are made so that the answers could easily be found on google. This will make sure that people are willing to help themselves before joining, and that wipes out a very large portion of the problems.

How about a sliding puzzle in an applet that isn’t solvable until you decompile it/figure out the html/some other thing requiring general knowlege.[/quote]
The point of this is not to make sure that only java coders join, it’s to filter out the complete idiots refusing to learn anything.

item.title: Can we get rid of the Aryan section finally
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Cheesehunk:

You can always click the little “Minus” button on the forum… However, it seems like we are getting so many errors nowadays, maybe removing the section would decrease the Forums stress load a bit?

The thing is, it doesn’t make a big difference because you can still see a “placeholder”.
Yeah, those errors are getting annoying.
SRL has been giving me a lot of errors also, but I think that is just because dankness chose to use netfirms and they suck.

Read full topic
